Posts.Content:
Hello! There is no forum for liposarcoma but it is still a soft tissue tumor issue 
 I had about
 a 4in lipoma removed from my thigh two weeks ago today. It appeared and grew within less than two months. It was firm, fixed, painful, and located between the bone and deepest layer of muscle (quite deep seeded). It’s been 14 days and still no news about
 pathology/biopsy. I’m getting concerned and stressed. Can anyone tell me how good or bad this sounds? I thought pathology usually takes about
 3-7 days...
Any help is greatly appreciated!
Posts.Title: 14 Day Wait for Lipoma Biopsy and Counting

Posts.Content:
Hi Susie,
Thank you for the response. They did say they would call. I have not been back yet but have an appointment on Monday to look at the wound. I called them last Thursday to schedule the follow-up and also asked if they knew anything yet- they said they had no updates for me at that point.
Posts.Title: 14 Day Wait for Lipoma Biopsy and Counting
